large-group-materials.tg_materials-caption: Big Book: I Want to Grow

section-block.tg_bullet-directions: Use Circle Time to build math background, engage children with a measurement activity, and introduce vocabulary (equal, ruler).
Begin Story Time by asking, What is one way Herb tries to grow taller?
Read for enjoyment and understanding, with a focus on measurement.
Check understanding. Differentiate as needed.
Share the daily writing option.

section-block.tg_skills-focus_body: Measurement: Measure, describe, and compare height and length of objects using like units and words like “small,” “big,” “short,” “tall,” and “long”; Know the purpose of common measuring tools (e.g., ruler, scale, measuring cup/spoon); Use formal or informal measurement tools (e.g., balance scale, cups, blocks, paper clips, etc.) to observe and describe length.

tg_skills-focus_body.tg_skills-focus-skill-text: Collect, organize, and present data graphically.
Talk and share.
Use sentences with multiple phrases.
Understand and use a growing number of math words.

section-block.tg_bullet-directions: Have children measure and compare the heights of classroom objects.
Guide children to practice using a ruler and graphing results.
Differentiate and modify as needed.

section-block.tg_ind-center_teacher-talk: Find one thing on the page that is tall. How do you know it is tall?
What is the highest thing you can reach in the kitchen?
How can you use a ruler to measure the plants we grew?
Draw Herb and Muriel at the beginning of the book. How can you show that Herb is shorter?
Can you make the clay longer like Muriel did?
Use your finger to trace the letter R for ruler.
What can you do to make your tower taller?

large-group-materials.tg_materials-caption: Big Book: I Want to Grow

section-block.tg_bullet-directions: Use Circle Time to share the Mind Builder talk and share and introduce vocabulary (share).
Begin Story Time by connecting the Mind Builder to I Want to Grow.
Read closely to talk about how the characters share their thoughts and to review classification.
Offer an extended play opportunity.
Share the daily writing option.

section-block.tg_skills-focus_body: Measurement: Measure, describe, and compare height and length of objects using like units and words like “small,” “big,” “short,” “tall,” and “long.”

tg_skills-focus_body.tg_skills-focus-skill-text: Collect, organize, and present data graphically.
Talk and share.
Use sentences with multiple phrases.
Understand and use a growing number of math words.

section-block.tg_bullet-directions: Have children describe an object on an Activity Card as tall or short.
Encourage children to discuss their own experiences.
Guide children to graph results.
Differentiate and modify as needed.

section-block.tg_ind-center_teacher-talk: Is there anything on this page that can grow? Point to it.
What happens if you stand on a step? Do you look taller or shorter?
Can you use a ruler to draw a straight line?
Write a story about a very short animal. Where does it live?
Use clay to make two objects. Which is shorter?
How many letters are in the word ruler?
Can you use blocks to measure the height of an object? How?

large-group-materials.tg_materials-caption: Big Book: I Want to Grow

section-block.tg_bullet-directions: Use Circle Time to build math background, engage children with song, and introduce vocabulary (height).
Begin Story Time by revisiting I Want to Grow and asking the guiding question, How can Herb and Muriel tell that they have grown?
Read interactively for deeper comprehension and to review height.
Check understanding. Differentiate as needed.
Share the daily writing option.

section-block.tg_skills-focus_body: Measurement: Measure, describe, and compare height and length of objects using like units and words like “small,” “big,” “short,” “tall,” and “long”; Know the purpose of common measuring tools (e.g., ruler, scale, measuring cup/spoon); Use formal or informal measurement tools (e.g., balance scale, cups, blocks, paper clips, etc.) to observe and describe length.

tg_skills-focus_body.tg_skills-focus-skill-text: Collect, organize, and present data graphically.
Talk and share.
Use sentences with multiple phrases.
Understand and use a growing number of math words.

section-block.tg_bullet-directions: Remeasure children’s heights, recording the data on the height chart from Theme 3, Week 3.
Guide children to compare their initial height to their current height.
Differentiate and modify as needed.

section-block.tg_ind-center_teacher-talk: Is the character in this book tall? How can you tell?
Construction workers measure a lot. Pretend that you are building something and measuring it with a tool.
Is this block taller or shorter than a ruler?
Describe another way Herb could have tried to make himself taller.
Design some shoes that would make you look taller.
What sound do you hear at the start of the word height?
Build a tall bridge and a short boat. Can the boat go under the bridge?

section-block.tg_copyright-line: TM ® & © Scholastic Inc. All rights reserved. I Want to Grow by Ged Adamson. Copyright © 2017 by Ged Adamson. Published by Scholastic Inc. by arrangement with Boyds Mills Press, an imprint of Highlights.

large-group-materials.tg_materials-caption: Big Chart of Big Ideas: What We Have Learned

section-block.tg_bullet-directions: Use Circle Time to discuss this week’s discoveries, engage children with an investigating activity, and introduce vocabulary (investigate, discover).
Begin Story Time by connecting the texts What We Have Learned and I Want to Grow.
Read closely to connect to this week’s concept question, How have we changed?
Offer an extended play opportunity.
Share the daily writing option.

section-block.tg_skills-focus_body: Measurement: Measure, describe, and compare height and length of objects using like units and words like “small,” “big,” “short,” “tall,” and “long.”

tg_skills-focus_body.tg_skills-focus-skill-text: Collect, organize, and present data graphically.
Talk and share.
Use sentences with multiple phrases.
Understand and use a growing number of math words.

section-block.tg_bullet-directions: Have children ask a partner a question to learn more about them.
Guide children to graph their partner’s answer and discover something about their friends by comparing responses.
Differentiate and modify as needed.

section-block.tg_ind-center_teacher-talk: Do you think you are shorter or taller than the character in this book? Why do you think that?
Pretend to be a firefighter. What kind of equipment will you need to reach the top of tall buildings?
Can you arrange these objects from shortest to tallest?
What is something you look forward to doing when you are taller?
What was your favorite thing that you learned this year? Can you create a picture of it?
Which letter appears more than once in tall? Circle it.
Build two towers. Which is shorter?

large-group-materials.tg_materials-caption: Big Book: I Want to Grow

section-block.tg_bullet-directions: Use Circle Time to make a graph of children’s favorite characters and engage children in a dancing activity.
Start Story Time by revisiting the book I Want to Grow and asking, How has Herb changed at the end of the book?
Read and retell interactively for physical engagement and to review classification.
Check understanding. Differentiate as needed.
Share the daily writing option.

section-block.tg_skills-focus_body: Measurement: Measure, describe, and compare height and length of objects using like units and words like “small,” “big,” “short,” “tall,” and “long.”

tg_skills-focus_body.tg_skills-focus-skill-text: Collect, organize, and present data graphically.
Talk and share.
Use sentences with multiple phrases.
Understand and use a growing number of math words.
Write for different purposes.

section-block.tg_bullet-directions: Support children as they independently respond to this week’s prompt: How have you changed since starting preschool?
Differentiate and modify as needed.
Save children’s writing to display next week.

section-block.tg_ind-center_teacher-talk: How does the character change in this book?
Pretend that you are as short as an ant! What will you do?
Imagine you have found a new type of flower. What tool will you use to measure it?
Imagine you grew as tall as a building overnight! Write a story about what you would do.
Make a new type of flower no one has seen before. How tall is it?
Create a name for a new flower you just discovered. What letter does it start with?
Use blocks to create a pot for your new flower. How tall will your pot have to be for the flower to fit?

tg_skills-focus_body.tg_skills-focus-skill-text: Recognize and compare heights or lengths of people or objects.
Collect data and organize it in a graphic representation.
Talk and share.
Use sentences with more than one phrase.
Demonstrate understanding of terms used in the instructional language of the classroom.

Recognize and compare heights or lengths of people or objects.
Collect data and organize it in a graphic representation.
Talk and share.
Use sentences with more than one phrase.
Demonstrate understanding of terms used in the instructional language of the classroom.
Independently write to communicate ideas for a variety of purposes.
